content: at the top of the next page you will see two wraps these slide if pushed and two big bumps these are a wrap and a ridge stuck together and it is the one furthest from your needle that you work into 6 work the first joining ridge into this bump when you have worked your ten joining ridges you will be level with the cast on edge and ready to work the first of many single corners single corner the single corner consists of the first two steps of the double corner step 1 ridge 1 k9 w&t k9 ridge 2 k8 w&t k8 ridge 3 k7 w&t k7 ridge 4 k6 w&t k6 ridge 5 k5 w&t k5 ridge 6 k4 w&t k4 ridge 7 k3 w&t k3 ridge 8 k2 w&t k2 ridge 9 k1 w&t k1 7 step 2 ridge 1 k2 w&t k2 ridge 2 k3 w&t k3 ridge 3 k4 w&t k4 ridge 4 k5 w&t k5 ridge 5 k6 w&t k6 ridge 6 k7 w&t k7 ridge 7 k8 w&t k8 ridge 8 k9 w&t k9 the cast on edge now work another ten joining ridges into the cast on edge this is the last time you ll have to count the ridges work the first joining ridge into the same place as the last join before the corner or as near as you can get to it when you get to the next corner where the cast on tail of yarn is work another single corner as before from now on you can stop counting the joining ridges just work along the sides until you get to the next corner do a single corner to get round it and carry on the stitch markers mark the point where you work the corners both the last joining ridge of the old side and the first of the new should be worked into this point so … carry on like this until your square is big enough obviously you will need to end when your knitting is a square not a rectangle so watch out for this 8 i stopped after adding six rounds of strips to that starting square when my knitting measured about 48 cm / 19 either cast off after the last ridge or stop one row short of the corner and cast off on the next row - whichever you think looks best your knitted square won t be an even square but you don t need to worry about those wobbly edges for a cushion sewing it together the cover is sewn round the cushion pad with four diagonal seams each one worked from the centre out the pad gives a bit of support as you are working begin by sewing the four points together in the middle of the cushion and then work the first seam take a stitch from the end of every other ridge alternating between the two sides the path of the stitches is basically
